metadata.title: CVE-2023-52809 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:libfc: Fix potential NULL pointer dereference in fc_lport_ptp_setup()fc_lport_ptp_setup() did not check the return value of fc_rport_create()which can return NULL and would cause a NULL pointer dereference. Addressthis issue by checking return value of fc_rport_create() and log errormessage on fc_rport_create() failed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52809` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-229-generic - 4.15.0-229.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-229-generic - 4.15.0-229.241
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-229-lowlatency - 4.15.0-229.241
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1156-kvm - 4.15.0-1156.161
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1173-aws - 4.15.0-1173.186
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1181-azure - 4.15.0-1181.196
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1166-gcp - 4.15.0-1166.183
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1135-oracle - 4.15.0-1135.146
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-229.241').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-173.191~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.161').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1173.186').
